intro: Lepidagathis nemoralis, commonly known as the common lepidagathis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest floors. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes. Lepidagathis nemoralis is native to various regions in Africa and is often found in humid, temperate climates. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies of understory vegetation.
